abstract: Lee Evans, handyman accused of murdering four boys who worked for him in Newark in 1978, will represent himself in his trial despite lack of evidence; says proof of his innocence can be found in his refusal to plead guilty and accept plea bargain.
snippet: Lee Anthony Evans is representing himself after being accused by prosecutors of killing five teenagers in 1978 despite a lack of physical evidence.
lead_paragraph: Lee Anthony Evans is representing himself after being accused by prosecutors of killing five teenagers in 1978 despite a lack of physical evidence.

headline.main: Man Accused in ’78 Newark Killings Goes on Trial
headline.print_headline: Man Accused in ’78 Newark Killings Goes on Trial
